name: TransHarmony
description:
This project has been made under a 2 week schedule in a workshop (game jam) in collaboration with the TransMusicales. 

The goal was to, in groups, conceptualize and make a simple, short and accessible game, that had as a strategy to showcase one or several axes of the TransMusicales heritage, including the festival and their other activities. 

The project's strategy was to offer a bridge between the public - advised or not - and elements identified as relevant in a field documentary study with the TransMusicales staff, by pulling them into a video game experience in respect with the Trans Musicales spirit.

Embody the Transmusicales' organisation manager, and try to make this years's edition as succesfull as possible by answering the artists requests as soon as they come up.

The game is a music paced game, in which you can decide to play casually, or as an hardcore player. 

You will first be issued requests which will have to be overcome within the time limit. The completed halls (where the requests come-up), will now be unlocked for the rest of the game. 

Then, the festival now starts and your goal will be to complete as much "real-time" request as possible. 

The game features an increasing level difficulty, allowing all players to reach their full potential, and to be challenged as it gets harder.

Based around a simple drag-and-drop feature, the game is easily learnable, and it's mechanics are easy to get a grab on. 

Turn your sound on, get ready, and try to make as much points as possible !
